Name: Prohibiting owners of commercial premises from knowingly leasing commercial premises to unlicensed sellers of controlled substances or tobacco products and requiring the sheriff to produce a monthly report on enforcement relating to such unlicensed seller
Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to prohibiting owners of commercial premises from knowingly leasing commercial premises to unlicensed sellers of controlled substances or tobacco products and requiring the sheriff to produce a monthly report on enforcement relating to such unlicensed sellers

History.Description: This Introduction was Introduced by Council
This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Public Safety

Summary: This bill would prohibit knowingly leasing commercial premises to a tenant who uses the premises for the distribution or sale of controlled substances or tobacco products without a license. The first time that an unlicensed controlled substance or unlicensed tobacco product seller is found to be operating in leased commercial premises, the Sheriff, Police Department, or any other relevant agency would issue a warning to the owner of the premises. If an unlicensed seller is later found to be operating in the same commercial premises, the owner would be liable for civil penalties. This bill would also require the Sheriff, in collaboration with the police department and any other relevant agency, to submit to the Mayor and the Council a monthly report on enforcement relating to unlicensed controlled substances or unlicensed tobacco product sellers.
Text:
Be it enacted by the Council as follows:
      
      
      Section 1. Chapter 1 of title 10 of the administrative code of the city of New York is amended by adding a new section 10-186 to read as follows: 
      � 10-186 Leasing commercial premises to unlicensed sellers of controlled substances and tobacco products. a. Definitions. For the purposes of this section the following terms have the following meanings: 
      Controlled substance. The term "controlled substance" has the same meaning as set forth in section 802 of title 21 of the United States code. 
      Tobacco product. The term "tobacco product" has the same meaning as set forth in section 17-702. 
      Unlicensed controlled substances seller. The term "unlicensed controlled substances seller" means a retailer, distributor, or other seller of a controlled substance operating without a license to sell such controlled substance.
      Unlicensed seller. The term "unlicensed seller" means an unlicensed controlled substances seller or an unlicensed tobacco products seller.
      Unlicensed tobacco product seller. The term "unlicensed tobacco produce seller" means a retailer, distributor, or other seller of a tobacco product operating without a license to sell such tobacco product. 
      b. No person shall knowingly lease commercial premises to an unlicensed controlled substances or unlicensed tobacco product seller who uses or intends to use such commercial premises to distribute, sell, or offer to sell, respectively, a controlled substance or tobacco product. It shall be an affirmative defense to a violation of this subdivision that the owner of the commercial premises has commenced a proceeding to evict such unlicensed seller.
      c. The first time that the sheriff or any other agency finds that an unlicensed controlled substance or unlicensed tobacco product seller is distributing, selling, or offering to sell, respectively, a controlled substance or tobacco product in commercial premises that the unlicensed seller has leased, the sheriff or other agency shall issue a written warning to the owner of the premises by certified mail. Such warning shall constitute presumptive evidence that the owner knowingly leases commercial premises in violation of subdivision b of this section.   
      d. If the sheriff or any other agency finds that an unlicensed controlled substance or unlicensed tobacco product seller is distributing, selling, or offering to sell, respectively, a controlled substance or tobacco product in commercial premises and the owner of such premises has previously been issued a warning pursuant to subdivision c of this section regarding the same premises, the owner shall be liable for the civil penalties set forth in subdivision e of this section. 
      e. Any person who violates subdivision b of this section shall be liable for a civil penalty of $1,000 for the first violation and $2,000 for each subsequent violation. 
      � 2. Chapter 5 of title 7 of the administrative code of the city of New York is amended by adding a new section 7-517 to read as follows:
      � 7-517 Report on enforcement against unlicensed controlled substance and tobacco product sellers. a. Definitions. For the purposes of this section the following terms have the following meanings: 
      Controlled substance. The term "controlled substance" has the same meaning as set forth in section 802 of title 21 of the United States code. 
      Tobacco product. The term "tobacco product" has the same meaning as set forth in section 17-702. 
      Unlicensed controlled substances seller. The term "unlicensed controlled substances seller" means a retailer, distributor, or other seller of a controlled substance operating without a license to sell such controlled substance.
      Unlicensed seller. The term "unlicensed seller" means an unlicensed controlled substances seller or an unlicensed tobacco products seller.
      Unlicensed tobacco product seller. The term "unlicensed tobacco produce seller" means a retailer, distributor, or other seller of a tobacco product operating without a license to sell such tobacco product. 
      b. The sheriff, in collaboration with any other relevant agency, shall provide a monthly report to the mayor and the speaker of the council on enforcement actions relating to unlicensed sellers in the previous month. Such report shall include, for every enforcement action taken against an unlicensed seller: 
      1. The date the enforcement action occurred;
      2. The location of the unlicensed seller that was the subject of the enforcement action;
      3. The name of the unlicensed seller;
      4. Whether or not controlled substances or tobacco products were seized from the unlicensed seller;
      5. The contents of the controlled substance or tobacco products that were seized from each unlicensed seller;
      6. The amount of products, broken down by weight and type of product, seized from the unlicensed seller;
      7. Whether or not the unlicensed seller received a civil notice; 
      8. Whether or not the unlicensed seller was issued a summons; 
      9. Whether or not an arrest was made and, if applicable, the number of arrests; and 
      10. If the unlicensed seller was operating out of leased commercial premises, whether the owner of the commercial premises was issued a warning or penalty pursuant to section 10-186 and, if applicable, the dollar amount of the penalty issued. 
      � 3. This local law takes effect immediately.
